Yoink â€” download/run GitHub release binaries.

Usage:
- yoink owner/repo
- Downloads latest release binary to the current directory.
- Stdout: ./binary (one line per downloaded binary).
- yoink -C <dir> owner/repo
- Downloads into <dir> and prints absolute paths.
- yoink owner/repo [args...]
- Downloads to a temp directory and runs it; nothing is saved.
- yoink -j owner/repo
- Stdout JSON: repo, tag, url, asset, paths (absolute).
- yoink -jI owner/repo
- JSON metadata only (no download); paths is empty.
- One-liner: sh <(curl https://yoink.sh) owner/repo [args...]
- Install to PATH: sh <(curl https://yoink.sh) -C ~/.local/bin owner/repo
